topic.title: How to Number Pages, Tables, and Figures Within Chapter Scope

indexterm.product: author developer editor authorEclipse developerEclipse editorEclipse

body.p: By default, the table titles are formatted like this:Table TT. Lore Ipsum Title
Similarly, the figures are formatted like this:
TT is the number of the table (table counter) that starts being counted from the beginning of the publication.
FF is the number of the figure (figure counter) that starts being counted from the beginning of the publication.
A common use-case is to have those two counters be incremented within the scope of each chapter, and prefixed by the number of each chapter like in the following example for tables:
body.codeblock: 1. First Chapter Table 1.1 Installation Table 1.2 Prerequisites 2. Second Chapter Table 2.1 Tools Table 2.2 Accessories 3. Third Chapter Table 3.1 Cleanup
